column5: Sweeeeet eye candy! Thanks for sharing, Mike. Likewise, all the best in the New Year to you and your family.  I suppose that was enough pics, I guess. Oh well, at least I got to see some  ... as I keep fishing vicariously through you!   cheers  p.-
I think that's a Raven IM8, customized of course.  p.-

Wow... Great Job!  I still haven't caught anything on the pin i got from you yet.  That's the problem with being only 15, I still have to get my parents to drive me when there not busy.And when there not the river is either blown or gin clear. Oh well, i guess i can wait.  Keep the reports coming!

Nice job guys...too bad I had plans,as it would of been an amazing trip !! I looked at the weather report Sunday, and new I would be seeing a report like this soon enough.... Awesome pics as usual Mike .... That new ang specs has got me droooling again
looks like a mint trip bud
Wow Mike, outstanding report and pics.  Happy New Year to you also.  Joey
Solid report! To bad the American fish fight like french solders!....lol

Wow, that is a ton of fish pictures you posted. Sounds like great timing and the right choice of river for fish.  Good to see you sharing the wealth of experience with those (Bill, Cliff) who have the same enthusiasm.  Thanks for posting report, ehg
Looks like you guys had lots of fun. Smiles all around. Any big ones?
great report.... makes me wish the rivers in my stomping ground were still open  what kind of rod is that in the first picture posted??

Mike, Even though the masters (you, BillM and Cliff) slayed'em, I somehow believe that the fish you enjoyed most was the first one that Liam caught.  That was a fabulous grin, one I remember on me a little while ago.  Solopaddler is a true expert in every sense - he will put you on fish, show you how to catch em, and then giggle along side as you hold a beautiful piece of fishy chrome.  Another great report, Mike.  Thanks.
